Class Cipher

  • java.lang.Object
    • Cipher

  • public class Cipher
extends java.lang.Object

    Cipher- This program implements a userInterface that allows the user to encode and decode files. It supports overwriting of the files as well. The cypher is run on the basis of substitution. The class variables hold the cypher substitutions used. The program will read in the input file and parse it line by line and encode and decode it and rewrite it to the output file.

    Sites used as reference are linked below:

    http://entertainment.howstuffworks.com/puzzles/cryptoquote-puzzles.htm

    • Field Detail

      • ALPHABET

        public static final java.lang.String ALPHABET
        These are the cypher strings. They are referenced to determine what index and ultimately, what substituion to use. ALPHABET is the base non-encoded version.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REPLACEMENT

        public static final java.lang.String REPLACEMENT
        These are the cypher strings. They are referenced to determine what index and ultimately, what substituion to use. REPLACEMENT is the base encoded version.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REPLACEMENTCAPS

        public static final java.lang.String REPLACEMENTCAPS
        These are the cypher strings. They are referenced to determine what index and ultimately, what substituion to use. REPLACEMENTCAPS is the base, capitilized encoded version.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

        Prints program header once.

        Persistantly runs the user interface until user quits.
        Parameters:
        args - None.

      • userInterface

        public static void userInterface()
        Runs the user interface and calls on the encoding and decoding methods.

      • getInputScanner

        public static java.util.Scanner getInputScanner(java.util.Scanner console)
        Get's input file to open scanner with. This is the file that holds the text that will be encodede/decoded. Has FileNotFound support.
        Parameters:
        console - is user input to enter the input file
        Returns:
        Scanner for program to use to scan text file.

      • getOutputPrintStream

        public static java.io.PrintStream getOutputPrintStream(java.util.Scanner console)
        Get's output file to open printstream with. This is the file that holds the text that will is encoded/decoded. Has Overwrite and same file Overwrite support.
        Parameters:
        console - is user input to enter the output file
        Returns:
        PrintStream for program to use to print to text file.

      • processFile

        public static void processFile(boolean encode,
               java.util.Scanner input,
               java.io.PrintStream output)
        Get's encoding or decoding instrurction. The input scanner and output printstream are used to read and write text. Calls encode and decode methods line by line then then prints line by line. Small same file overwrite process; renames temp file to overwrite previous filename.
        Parameters:
        encode - to signal encode or decode process.
        input - is input file Scanner.
        output - is output file PrintStream.

      • encodeLine

        public static java.lang.String encodeLine(java.lang.String line)
        Get's line to be encoded. Parse the line token by token. References the cypher strings to exhange indexes. New character is selected and concatenated into new line.
        Parameters:
        line - passed in to be encoded.
        Returns:
        String of newly encoded line.

      • decodeLine

        public static java.lang.String decodeLine(java.lang.String line)
        Get's line to be decoded. Parse the line token by token. References the cypher strings to exhange indexes between ALPHABET AND CYPHER. New character is selected and concatenated into new line.
        Parameters:
        line - passed in to be encoded.
        Returns:
        String of newly encoded line.

      • resetVars

        public static void resetVars()
        Refreshes flag variables and some file names. Ensures userInterface seperates file processes.
